verses.esv: 40 But all things should be done decently and in order.
verses.kjv: 40 Let all things be done decently and in order.
verses.niv: 40 But everything should be done in a fitting and orderly way.

verses.esv: 5 for if someone does not know how to manage his own household, how will he care for God’s church?
verses.kjv: 5 (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)
verses.niv: 5 (If anyone does not know how to manage his own family, how can he take care of God's church?)

verses.esv: 43 “When the unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, but finds none. 44 Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ And when it comes, it finds the house empty, swept, and put in order. 45 Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and dwell there, and the last state of that person is worse than the first. So also will it be with this evil generation.”
verses.kjv: 43 When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none. 44 Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished. 45 Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.
verses.niv: 43 "When an evil spirit comes out of a man, it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it. 44 Then it says, 'I will return to the house I left.' When it arrives, it finds the house unoccupied, swept clean and put in order. 45 Then it goes and takes with it seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that man is worse than the first. That is how it will be with this wicked generation."

verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,

verses.esv:
3   By wisdom a house is built,
    and by understanding it is established;
verses.kjv: 3 Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:
verses.niv: 3 By wisdom a house is built, and through understanding it is established;

verses.esv: 5 to be self-controlled, pure, working at home, kind, and submissive to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be reviled.
verses.kjv: 5 To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
verses.niv: 5 to be self-controlled and pure, to be busy at home, to be kind, and to be subject to their husbands, so that no one will malign the word of God.

verses.esv: 25 And when it comes, it finds the house swept and put in order.
verses.kjv: 25 And when he cometh, he findeth it swept and garnished.
verses.niv: 25 When it arrives, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.

verses.esv:
10   Create in me a clean heart, O God,
    and renew a right spirit within me.
verses.kjv: 10 Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
verses.niv: 10 Create in me a pure heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.

verses.esv: 44 Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ And when it comes, it finds the house empty, swept, and put in order.
verses.kjv: 44 Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.
verses.niv: 44 Then it says, 'I will return to the house I left.' When it arrives, it finds the house unoccupied, swept clean and put in order.

verses.esv:
14:1   The wisest of women builds her house,
    but folly with her own hands tears it down.
verses.kjv: 1 Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
verses.niv: 1 The wise woman builds her house, but with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down.

verses.esv:
27   She looks well to the ways of her household
    and does not eat the bread of idleness.
verses.kjv: 27 She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
verses.niv: 27 She watches over the affairs of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness.

verses.esv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.kjv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.niv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

verses.esv: 15 Look carefully then how you walk, not as unwise but as wise, 16 making the best use of the time, because the days are evil.
verses.kjv: 15 See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise, 16 Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
verses.niv: 15 Be very careful, then, how you live--not as unwise but as wise, 16 making the most of every opportunity, because the days are evil.

verses.esv:
7   Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
    wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
verses.kjv: 7 Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
verses.niv: 7 Cleanse me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

verses.esv: 46 Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes.
verses.kjv: 46 Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
verses.niv: 46 It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.

verses.esv: 7 for God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
verses.kjv: 7 For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
verses.niv: 7 For God did not give us a spirit of timidity, but a spirit of power, of love and of self-discipline.

verses.esv: 38 Now as they went on their way, Jesus entered a village. And a woman named Martha welcomed him into her house. 39 And she had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord’s feet and listened to his teaching. 40 But Martha was distracted with much serving. And she went up to him and said, “Lord, do you not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Tell her then to help me.” 41 But the Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things, 42 but one thing is necessary. Mary has chosen the good portion, which will not be taken away from her.”
verses.kjv: 38 Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house. 39 And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his word. 40 But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me. 41 And Jesus answered and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things: 42 But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.
verses.niv: 38 As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him. 39 She had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord's feet listening to what he said. 40 But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, "Lord, don't you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!" 41 "Martha, Martha," the Lord answered, "you are worried and upset about many things, 42 but only one thing is needed. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her."

verses.esv:
9   Who can say, “I have made my heart pure;
    I am clean from my sin”?
verses.kjv: 9 Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
verses.niv: 9 Who can say, "I have kept my heart pure; I am clean and without sin"?

verses.esv: 26 You blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and the plate, that the outside also may be clean.
verses.kjv: 26 Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.
verses.niv: 26 Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.

verses.esv: 14 Do all things without grumbling or disputing,
verses.kjv: 14 Do all things without murmurings and disputings:
verses.niv: 14 Do everything without complaining or arguing,

verses.esv: 14 I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean in itself, but it is unclean for anyone who thinks it unclean.
verses.kjv: 14 I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
verses.niv: 14 As one who is in the Lord Jesus, I am fully convinced that no food is unclean in itself. But if anyone regards something as unclean, then for him it is unclean.

verses.esv: 25 I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you shall be clean from all your uncleannesses, and from all your idols I will cleanse you.
verses.kjv: 25 Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you, and ye shall be clean: from all your filthiness, and from all your idols, will I cleanse you.
verses.niv: 25 I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean; I will cleanse you from all your impurities and from all your idols.

verses.esv: 31 Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice. 32 Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.kjv: 31 Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice: 32 And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.niv: 31 Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice. 32 Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.esv:
13   Whoever conceals his transgressions will not prosper,
    but he who confesses and forsakes them will obtain mercy.
verses.kjv: 13 He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
verses.niv: 13 He who conceals his sins does not prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy.

verses.esv: 8 Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
verses.kjv: 8 Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.
verses.niv: 8 Come near to God and he will come near to you. Wash your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
